results.title: Calcium antagonist prevents calcium flux induced necrosis and apoptosis in ischemic reperfusion of rat liver.
results.text_hl: These findings showed that the mechanism of regulation of @GENE_BCL2 @GENE_24224 @@@Bcl-2@@@ gene expression by @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ may be the inhibitory action of Ca(2+) entry into mitochondria and prevent apoptosis and @<m>DISEASE_Necrosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009336 @@@necrosis@@@.

citations.NLM: Chattopadhyay P, Verma N, Verma A, Shukla G, Wahi AK. Calcium antagonist prevents calcium flux induced necrosis and apoptosis in ischemic reperfusion of rat liver. Indian J Clin Biochem. 2008 Oct;23(4):356-60. PMID: 23105786

results.title: Effect of nicorandil and amlodipine on bio-chemical parameters during isoproterenol induced myocardial necrosis in rats.
results.text_hl: Effect of @CHEMICAL_Nicorandil @CHEMICAL_MESH:D020108 @@@nicorandil@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ on bio-chemical parameters during @CHEMICAL_Isoproterenol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007545 @@@isoproterenol@@@ induced @<m>DISEASE_Necrosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009336 @@@myocardial necrosis@@@ in @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.

citations.NLM: Singh N, Kumar R. Effect of nicorandil and amlodipine on bio-chemical parameters during isoproterenol induced myocardial necrosis in rats. Indian J Clin Biochem. 2003 Jan;18(1):99-102. PMID: 23105380

results.title: In vitro and in vivo efficacies of amlodipine against Listeria monocytogenes.
results.journal: Eur J Clin Microbiol Infect Dis
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@Aml@@@ administered orally at 2.5 microg/g in female @CELLLINE_CVCL:0184 @@@BALB/c@@@ @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@ for 7 days, commencing 4 days before oral challenge (1 x 10(8) CFU/ml with L. monocytogenes ATCC 51774), significantly reduced bacterial counts in the stomach (P < 0.01), liver (P < 0.01), and spleen (P < 0.05), and decreased (P < 0.05) @DISEASE_Stomach_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D013272 @@@gastric lesions@@@, neutrophilic infiltration, @DISEASE_Edema @DISEASE_MESH:D004487 @@@edema@@@, vascular @DISEASE_Nerve_Degeneration @DISEASE_MESH:D009410 @@@degeneration@@@, and @<m>DISEASE_Necrosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009336 @@@necrosis@@@ of @DISEASE_Stomach_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D013274 @@@gastric tissues@@@.

citations.NLM: Dutta NK, Mazumdar K, DasGupta A, Dastidar SG. In vitro and in vivo efficacies of amlodipine against Listeria monocytogenes. Eur J Clin Microbiol Infect Dis. 2009 Jul;28(7):849-53. PMID: 19184140
citations.BibTeX: @article{19184140, title={In vitro and in vivo efficacies of amlodipine against Listeria monocytogenes.}, author={Dutta NK and Mazumdar K and DasGupta A and Dastidar SG}, journal={Eur J Clin Microbiol Infect Dis}, volume={28}, number={7}, pages={849-53}}

results.title: Development of a Radiolabeled Amlodipine Analog for L-type Calcium Channel Imaging.
results.text_hl: The calcium channel blockade activity (CCBA) and apoptosis/@<m>DISEASE_Necrosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009336 @@@necrosis@@@ assay of @CHEMICAL_Pentetic_Acid @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004369 @@@DTPA@@@-@<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ conjugate evaluations were performed for the conjugate.

citations.NLM: Firouzyar T, Jalilian AR, Aboudzadeh MR, Sadeghpour H, Pooladi M, Shafiee-Ardestani M, Khalaj A. Development of a Radiolabeled Amlodipine Analog for L-type Calcium Channel Imaging. Curr Radiopharm. 2017;10(1):51-58. PMID: 28056732

results.title: Improvement in the histopathology of hearts from cardiomyopathic BIO TO-2 hamsters following long-term administration of amlodipine and cilnidipine.
results.text_hl: In conclusion, the present study has shown that long-term administration of @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ and @CHEMICAL_cilnidipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:C065927 @@@cilnidipine@@@ improves @CHEMICAL_Calcium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002118 @@@calcium@@@ deposition and @<m>DISEASE_Necrosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009336 @@@necrosis@@@ in the myocardium from @CELLLINE_CVCL:A628 @@@BIO TO-2@@@ @SPECIES_10026 @@@hamsters@@@.

citations.NLM: Urayama A, Yamada S, Hirano K, Kimura R, Watanabe H, Ohashi K. Improvement in the histopathology of hearts from cardiomyopathic BIO TO-2 hamsters following long-term administration of amlodipine and cilnidipine. Biol Pharm Bull. 2000 Oct;23(10):1189-92. PMID: 11041249
citations.BibTeX: @article{11041249, title={Improvement in the histopathology of hearts from cardiomyopathic BIO TO-2 hamsters following long-term administration of amlodipine and cilnidipine.}, author={Urayama A and Yamada S and Hirano K and Kimura R and Watanabe H and Ohashi K}, journal={Biol Pharm Bull}, volume={23}, number={10}, pages={1189-92}}

results.title: Effect of prolonged treatment with amlodipine on enhanced vascular contractility in cardiomyopathic hamsters.
results.text_hl: The lack of effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ treatment on the responsiveness of @DISEASE_LEOPARD_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D044542 @@@CM@@@ mesenteric artery leads to the suggestion that the preventive effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ on focal @<m>DISEASE_Necrosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009336 @@@myocytolytic necrosis@@@ of cardiomyocytes, which was previously reported to be the main cause of @DISEASE_Cardiomyopathies @DISEASE_MESH:D009202 @@@cardiomyopathy@@@, results from an action on cardiomyocytes.

citations.NLM: Sato A, Hattori Y, Watanabe M, Okamoto H, Tomioka H, Fukao M, Sakuma I, Kitabatake A, Kanno M. Effect of prolonged treatment with amlodipine on enhanced vascular contractility in cardiomyopathic hamsters. J Cardiovasc Pharmacol. 1999 Jul;34(1):124-31. PMID: 10413078
citations.BibTeX: @article{10413078, title={Effect of prolonged treatment with amlodipine on enhanced vascular contractility in cardiomyopathic hamsters.}, author={Sato A and Hattori Y and Watanabe M and Okamoto H and Tomioka H and Fukao M and Sakuma I and Kitabatake A and Kanno M}, journal={J Cardiovasc Pharmacol}, volume={34}, number={1}, pages={124-31}}

results.title: Long term effects of amlodipine on organ damage, stroke and life span in stroke prone spontaneously hypertensive rats.
results.text_hl: At 15 weeks after starting @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ treatment, all control SHRSPs exhibited varying degrees of @DISEASE_Fibrosis @DISEASE_MESH:D005355 @@@myocardial fibrosis@@@, proliferative and/or @<m>DISEASE_Necrosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009336 @@@necrotic@@@ @DISEASE_Vasculitis @DISEASE_MESH:D014657 @@@vasculitis@@@ and @DISEASE_Kidney_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D007674 @@@glomerular lesions@@@, whereas only a few animals in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ group showed slight lesions.

citations.NLM: Suzuki M, Yamanaka K, Nabata H, Tachibana M. Long term effects of amlodipine on organ damage, stroke and life span in stroke prone spontaneously hypertensive rats. Eur J Pharmacol. 1993 Apr 1;228(5-6):269-74. PMID: 8482318
citations.BibTeX: @article{8482318, title={Long term effects of amlodipine on organ damage, stroke and life span in stroke prone spontaneously hypertensive rats.}, author={Suzuki M and Yamanaka K and Nabata H and Tachibana M}, journal={Eur J Pharmacol}, volume={228}, number={5-6}, pages={269-74}}

results.title: Ameliorating effects of amlodipine on plasma and myocardial catecholamines in BIO 53.58 Syrian hamsters, a model of dilated cardiomyopathy.
results.text_hl: In addition, @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ administration caused a significant reduction of @CHEMICAL_Calcium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002118 @@@calcium@@@ deposition with a tendency toward a decrease in the @<m>DISEASE_Necrosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009336 @@@myocardial necrosis@@@, and it had little effect on the affinity and number of specific binding for (+)-[3H]PN 200-110, (-)-[125I]iodocyanopindolol (CYP) and [3H]prazosin in the myocardium.

citations.NLM: Yamada S, Urayama A, Kimura R, Watanabe H, Ohashi K. Ameliorating effects of amlodipine on plasma and myocardial catecholamines in BIO 53.58 Syrian hamsters, a model of dilated cardiomyopathy. Life Sci. 2000 Nov 10;67(25):3051-9. PMID: 11125842
citations.BibTeX: @article{11125842, title={Ameliorating effects of amlodipine on plasma and myocardial catecholamines in BIO 53.58 Syrian hamsters, a model of dilated cardiomyopathy.}, author={Yamada S and Urayama A and Kimura R and Watanabe H and Ohashi K}, journal={Life Sci}, volume={67}, number={25}, pages={3051-9}}

results.title: Preparation and preclinical evaluation of 68Ga-DOTA-amlodipine for L-type calcium channel imaging
results.text_hl: ...@<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@Amlodipine@@@ @CHEMICAL_1_4_7_10_tetraazacyclododecane__1_4_7_10_tetraacetic_acid @CHEMICAL_MESH:C071349 @@@DOTA@@@ conjugate was synthesized, characterized and went through @CHEMICAL_Calcium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002118 @@@calcium@@@ channel blockade, @DISEASE_Drug_Related_Side_Effects_and_Adverse_Reactions @DISEASE_MESH:D064420 @@@toxicity@@@, apoptosis/@<m>DISEASE_Necrosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009336 @@@necrosis@@@ tests. [68Ga] DOTA AMLO was prepared at optimized conditions followed by stability tests, partition coefficient determination and biodistribution studies using tissue counting and co incidence imaging up to 2 h.

citations.NLM: Firuzyar T, Jalilian AR, Aboudzadeh MR, Sadeghpour H, Shafiee-Ardestani M, Khalaj A. Preparation and preclinical evaluation of 68Ga-DOTA-amlodipine for L-type calcium channel imaging Indian J Nucl Med. 2016 Oct-Dec;31(4):267-273. PMID: 27833311

results.title: Nature of the cardiomyocyte injury induced by lipid hydroperoxides.
results.text_hl: @<m>DISEASE_Necrosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009336 @@@Cardiomyocytes necrosis@@@ induced by @CHEMICAL_Calcium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002118 @@@calcium@@@ paradox was prevented by @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@Amlodipine@@@ (10 microM) and @CHEMICAL_R_56865 @CHEMICAL_MESH:C054551 @@@R56865@@@ (10 microM), but not by @CHEMICAL_4_5_Dihydro_1_(3_(trifluoromethyl)phenyl)_1H_pyrazol_3_amine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D015772 @@@BW755C@@@ (10 microM).

citations.NLM: Thollon C, Iliou JP, Cambarrat C, Robin F, Vilaine JP. Nature of the cardiomyocyte injury induced by lipid hydroperoxides. Cardiovasc Res. 1995 Nov;30(5):648-55. PMID: 8595608
